page.title: 20OCCUPATIONS SURVEY
page.content: During the course of the Domesday Survey we were able to make a survey of parents' occupations, place of employment and mode of transport used. Many fathers were employed locally in practical trades such as painting, decorating,building,plumbing,electrica l work and gardening.Others worked in the nearby towns in retail trades.Due to the fast rail link to London,many worked in the city,in offices.Some fathers worked as far away as Bedford, travelling up daily.Private car was the most popular mode of transport used. Many of the mothers worked locally in part time jobs such as cleaning,child- minding and serving in shops.Others worked full time as secretaries,office staff and teachers.For those mothers without a car,walking and cycling to work were common replies.
